December 28, 1975: Fiction
CURTAIN, by Agatha Christie. (Dodd, Mead, $7.95.) Can this be the end of
Hercule Poirot?
THE GREEK TREASURE, by Irving Stone. (Doubleday, $10.95.) Faithful if
sluggish novel about Heinrich Schliemann, discoverer of Troy.
RAGTIME, by E. L. Doctorow. (Random House, $8.95.) A syncopated-gaited
evocation of turn-of-the-century America.
THE CHOIRBOYS, by Joseph Wambaugh. (Delacorte, $8.95.) Tough and
scatological portrait of off-duty cops.
IN THE BEGINNING, by Chaim Potok. (Knopf, $8.95.) Familiar Potok theme -
orthodoxy vs. modernity - probed in greater depth.
LOOKING FOR MR. GOODBAR, by Judith Rossner. (Simon &Schuster, $7.95.)
Stunning psychological study of a woman's passive complicity in her own death.
THE EAGLE HAS LANDED, by Jack Higgins. (Holt, Rinehart & Winston, $8.95.)
Mixed fact and fiction about 1943 plot to kidnap Churchill.
SHOGUN, by James Clavell. (Atheneum, $12.50.) Sprawling tale of intrigue and
bloodshed in 17th-century Japan.
HUMBOLDT'S GIFT, by Saul Bellow. (Viking Press, $10.) Bellow on money, art,
power, and ideas in America.
NIGHTWORK, by Irwin Shaw. (Delacorte Press, $10.) A meek hotel clerk who
finds 100-grand meets a con man; sophisticated, worldly entertainment.
December 28, 1975
Non-Fiction
BRING ON THE EMPTY HORSES, by David Niven. (Putnam's, $9.95.) Superior
Hollywood anecdotiana.
THE RELAXATION RESPONSE, by Herbert Benson, M.D. (William Morrow,
$5.95.) Non-TM meditation technique to relieve tension.
SYLVIA PORTER'S MONEY BOOK, by Sylvia Porter, $12.50.) Useful home
financial adviser.
ANGELS, by Billy Graham. (Doubleday, $4.95.) Fundamentalist interpretation of
angels' role in heaven and on earth.
POWER!, by Michael Korda. (Random House, $8.95.) A guidebook for the
upwardly mobile with an amoral message.
WINNING THROUGH INTIMIDATION, by Robert J. Ringer. (Funk & Wagnalls,
$9.95.) How to close the big deal.
MY LIFE, by Golda Meir. (Putnam's, $12.50.) Stately, but often moving
autobiography of the  former Israeli Premier.
THE AGE OF NAPOLEON, by Will and Ariel Durant. (Simon & Schuster, $17.50.)
Popularized history that is more popularized than history.
THE NEW YORKER ALBUM OF DRAWINGS, 1925-1975. (Viking Press, $15.) A
cartoon history of our times.
MEMOIRS, by Tennessee Williams. (Doubleday, $8.95.) Candid account of his life
and loves.
